page.title: 17TOURISM IN MARSKE AREA.
page.content: Part of the area is in the Dales National Park land. Tourism has increased over the past ten years, the area becoming known as 'Herriot Country' following the T.V. series of veterinary stories set in the Yorkshire Dales. There are 9 holiday cottages and 3 houses doing Bed and Breakfast. Most tourists come to enjoy walking in the area, which is on the Coast to Coast route from Bee's Head to Robin Hood's Bay. A number of motorists come to enjoy the landscape & to visit the 2 Churches & 1 Chapel in the area. The Methodist Chapel at Clints was once a Roman Catholic Chapel. St Edmund's Church in Marske is a Norman Church. There is St Michael's Church in Downholme. A monument to Capt. Matthew Hutton, errected in 1814 on the Deerpark dominates the landscape.
